compute_linear_matter_correlation module¶

python version of python FFTLOG. Algorithm due to Andrew Hamilton. See http://casa.colorado.edu/~ajsh/FFTLog/

Joseph E. McEwen email: jmcewen314@gmail.com

Minor modifications of input/output formats and interpolation as part of this galaxy emulator pipline due to Ben Wibking. (June 2016) (ben@wibking.com).

compute_linear_matter_correlation.fft_log(k, f_k, q, mu)[source]¶

Compute the discrete Fourier transform of a log-spaced input signal.

compute_linear_matter_correlation.get_k0(N, mu, q, r0, L, k0)[source]¶
compute_linear_matter_correlation.k_to_r(k, f_k, alpha_k=1.5, beta_r=-1.5, mu=0.5, pf=0.06349363593424097, q=0)[source]¶

module to calculate Hankel Transform int_0^infty dk r A(k) J_mu(kr), via fftlog algorithm Common application is for power spectrum: xi(r)= int dk k^2 /(2 pi^2) sin(kr)/kr P(k) in which case alpha_k=1.5 beta_r=-1.5 mu=.5 pf=(2*np.pi)**(-1.5)

compute_linear_matter_correlation.log_gamma(z)[source]¶
compute_linear_matter_correlation.r_to_k(r, f_r, alpha_k=-1.5, beta_r=1.5, mu=0.5, pf=15.749609945722417, q=0)[source]¶

module to calculate Hankel Transform int_0^infty dr k A(r) J_mu(kr), via fftlog algorithm Common application is for correlation function: P(k)= 2 pi int dr r^2 sin(kr)/kr xi(r) in which case alpha_k=-1.5 beta_r=1.5 mu=.5 pf=4 pi *sqrt(pi/2)

compute_linear_matter_correlation.u_m_vals(m, mu, q, kr, L)[source]¶
